DataElement.preferredName: Diagnosis Code System PCORnet CDM Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A systematized collection of codes._ A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes.

Concepts.definition: A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: PCORnet Common Data Model Diagnosis Code System Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A data model designed to standardize PCORnet data._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A systematized collection of codes._ A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An extension of the ICD-9 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data. This extension included a section of procedure codes.

Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification
Concepts.definition: An extension of the ICD-9 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data. This extension included a section of procedure codes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An extension of the ICD-10 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data. This extension included a section of procedure codes.

Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification
Concepts.definition: An extension of the ICD-10 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data. This extension included a section of procedure codes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An extension of the ICD-11 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data.

Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases, Eleventh Revision, Clinical Modification
Concepts.definition: An extension of the ICD-11 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

Concepts.definition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Published by the College of American Pathologists, the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms is a combination of content of SNOMED Reference Terminology and READ codes.

Concepts.longName: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms
Concepts.definition: Published by the College of American Pathologists, the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms is a combination of content of SNOMED Reference Terminology and READ codes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
